## Why work in public? {background-color="`r clrs_lt[1]`"}

::: {.incremental}

- ~~Get famous~~
- Demystify the process of learning and gaining expertise
- Good for providing public goods for teaching and research
- Good for the scientific process and reproducibility
- Strengthen the R community
- **Provide resources for future you**

:::

## My strategies for encouraging wrongness and judgment-free curiosity {background-color="`r clrs_lt[2]`"}

::: {.incremental}

- Less informative grading
- Discover exciting and muddy things
- Work together live
- "Ask me X questions"

:::

## Less informative grading = <br>better motivation {background-color="`r clrs_lt[2]`"}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
![](img/jebo.png){fig-align="center" width="100%"}
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
- Granular grading systems (A, A−, B+, B, etc.) hurt motivation
- Use less informative grading (but still give feedback)
:::

::::

::: footer
[10.1016/j.jebo.2023.12.001](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jebo.2023.12.001){preview-link="true"}
:::
